transcript: i was raised by lesbians in the mountains and i sort of came like a forest gnome to new york city a while back really messed with my head but i 'll get into that later i i 'll start with on fire from the back of the volcano i don 't know why that happened that happens you know her tail terminates in a cycloptic eyeball made out of one thousand nine hundred and eighty six terrorist cards have you guys seen those they were made in the one thousand nine hundred and eighty 's they 're like baseball cards of terrorists way ahead of their time two projects one 's called psychogeographies it 's about a six year project to make one hundred of these humans each one is an archive of our culture through our ripped up media and matter whether it 's encyclopedias or dictionaries or magazines but each one acts as a sort of an archive in the shape of a human and they travel in groups of twenty four or twelve like cells they come together they divide and you kind of walk through them it 's taking me years each one is basically a microscope slide with a human stuck inside this one has a little cave in his chest there 's a waterfall coming out of his chest take you quickly through these works because i can 't explain them for too long there are the layers you can kind of see it that 's a body getting split in half this one has two heads and it 's communicating between the two heads you can see the pills coming out going into one head from this weird statue there 's a little forest scene inside the chest cavity can you see that anyway this talk 's all about
